content:
#6497, which proves Weierstrass' theorem that you can uniformly approximate continuous functions on [0,1] by polynomials (by explicitly showing the Bernstein approximations converge) is perhaps ready to merge. I think a few people have looked at it, and I've just merged master and fixed bitrot.

I'm happy to split off any of the changes to subsidiary files if that would be helpful.

I have two more largish PRs (presumably plus smaller ones for distant files) that give us Weierstrass' theorem stated "more abstractly", and for other intervals, and that give us the Stone-Weierstrass theorem in general. But these have been sitting on the backburner while #6497 is being reviewed.
